section.name: Architecture
section.p: MaPSeq is fronted by a collection of service interfaces (SOAP, RESTful, and Messaging). When a pipeline is deployed, a Java Messaging Service destination will be exposed. That messaging destination, only accepting valid JSON messages, will enqueue a WorkflowRun instance for that cooresponding workflow along with a specified Flowcell/Sample to process.

subsection.name: Web Services
subsection.p: The MaPSeq service interfaces are deployed as both RESTful services as well as SOAP services using Apache CXF. Please refer to the Web Service API for details

subsection.name: Schema
subsection.p: The MaPSeq data model is a joined inheritance model. There are two distinct inheritance models, one for dictionary items (Workflow, Study) and another for named entities (Flowcell, Sample). For reference, MaPSeq XSD
